quote: Some days are just bad days, that's all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day, that's just the way it is!
author: Dita Von Teese

quote: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, 'It might have been'.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: To have felt too much is to end in feeling nothing.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: First, accept sadness. Realize that without losing, winning isn't so great.
author: Alyssa Milano

quote: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: There is no despair so absolute as that which comes with the first moments of our first great sorrow, when we have not yet known what it is to have suffered and be healed, to have despaired and have recovered hope.
author: George Eliot

quote: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

quote: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: The sad truth is that opportunity doesn't knock twice.
author: Gloria Estefan

quote: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger, rage, fear, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.
author: Kevin Bacon

quote: Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Every life has a measure of sorrow, and sometimes this is what awakens us.
author: Steven Tyler

quote: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not wear it on their sleeves, but it's there if you look deep.
author: Taraji P. Henson

quote: Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: Sadness is also a kind of defence.
author: Ivo Andric

quote: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Red is the ultimate cure for sadness.
author: Bill Blass

quote: Dying is only one thing to be sad over... Living unhappily is something else.
author: Morrie Schwartz

quote: A teardrop on earth summons the King of heaven.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

quote: Depression is the inability to construct a future.
author: Rollo May

quote: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.
author: William Cowper

quote: Crying is cleansing. There's a reason for tears, happiness or sadness.
author: Dionne Warwick

quote: The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.
author: Saadi

quote: Experiencing sadness and anger can make you feel more creative, and by being creative, you can get beyond your pain or negativity.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
author: Sophocles

quote: In deep sadness there is no place for sentimentality.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Delicious tears! The heart's own dew.
author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quote: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart, don't know how to laugh either.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
author: William Blake

quote: Oh, I am very weary, Though tears no longer flow; My eyes are tired of weeping, My heart is sick of woe.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I do believe that if you haven't learnt about sadness, you cannot appreciate happiness.
author: Nana Mouskouri

quote: Sad will be the day for any man when he becomes contented with the thoughts he is thinking and the deeds he is doing - where there is not forever beating at the doors of his soul some great desire to do something larger; which he knows he was meant and made to do.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: We're taught to be ashamed of confusion, anger, fear and sadness, and to me they're of equal value to happiness, excitement and inspiration.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: One must not let oneself be overwhelmed by sadness.
author: Jackie Kennedy

quote: I've cried, and you'd think I'd be better for it, but the sadness just sleeps, and it stays in my spine the rest of my life.
author: Conor Oberst

quote: It doesn't hurt to feel sad from time to time.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: I seldom think about my limitations, and they never make me sad. Perhaps there is just a touch of yearning at times; but it is vague, like a breeze among flowers.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I had sadness for breakfast.
author: Andy Milonakis

quote: It's a sad man my friend who's livin' in his own skin and can't stand the company.
author: Bruce Springsteen

quote: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: In this world, full often, our joys are only the tender shadows which our sorrows cast.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: People are sad. People are broke. People are worried about money, people are worried that they're not enough and not amounting to anything and they don't feel good about themselves. People have rough times, and everybody's pretending it's not true, and we need to break that veneer.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: We never taste a perfect joy; our happiest successes are mixed with sadness.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
author: Jean Racine
